What are you looking for Advanced Search Home > All Categories > Dining Out > Fast Food > Resolved Question Fiona Member since: April 05, 2011 Total points: 90 (Level 1) Add Contact Block
Resolved Question Show me another » What is the difference between fast food restaurants and regular restaurants?
1 year ago Report Abuse by Orviston, PA Member since: November 04, 2009 Total points: 19,449 (Level 6) Add Contact Block
Best Answer - Chosen by Voters The type of food. Fast food is quick, low quality, fattening and cheap. Regular restuarants have more choices, better quality, more healthy options,&more expensive. 1 year ago Report Abuse 33% 2 Votes 1 person rated this as good
Action Bar: 0 stars - mark this as Interesting! Email Comment ( 0 ) Save Add to My Yahoo! RSS
There are currently no comments for this question.
* You must be logged into Answers to add comments. Sign in or Register .
This question about" What is the differen… "was originally asked on Yahoo! Answers Singapore
Other Answers (6) Show: All Answers Oldest to Newest Newest to Oldest Rated Highest to Lowest by net Member since: April 01, 2011 Total points: 145 (Level 1) Add Contact Block fast food is called fast food because you get your food in seconds after you order normally under a minute. Normally fast food is considered unhealthy but it really depends on what you order. These days you can order a salad from a fast food. So in a fast food restuarant the salad is already packaged and refrigerated, when you order they just pick that up and give you.
A regular restaurant is mostly a sitdown and dine experience. It takes atleast 5-10 mins for the food to arrive after you order. There is a waiter and all the formal process. If you order a salad, they will actually make a salad after you order it. You can call it slow food. Edited 1 year ago Report Abuse 17% 1 Vote by Rich Member since: February 15, 2010 Total points: 787 (Level 2) Add Contact Block fast food, food is ready when you get there, its cheaper, in and out in 10 minutes, and usually the food is lower quality and fried, restaurant, sit down meal, can take normally an hour, to an hour and half, more expensive, but this is because they take more time to prepare it and also will use much higher quality ingredients, and healthier methods of cooking than a fast food restaurant 1 year ago Report Abuse 17% 1 Vote by Treva Member since: December 08, 2010 Total points: 8,602 (Level 5) Add Contact Block the quality of the food is typically better/more expensive at a regular restaurant while fast food restaurants will have your food prepared faster. Typically if it has a drive thru window then it's fast food. 1 year ago Report Abuse 0% 0 Votes 1 person rated this as good by valerie m Member since: June 15, 2008 Total points: 27 (Level 1) Add Contact Block Alot of the times fast food because it is made in a fast way is less expensive than a typical restaurant and the food is not as good. 1 year ago Report Abuse 0% 0 Votes by BrianB Member since: March 01, 2006 Total points: 38,590 (Level 7) Add Contact Block There are two things 1. the drive thru, 2. the service with out a tip. and the food is hot! 1 year ago Report Abuse 17% 1 Vote by ? Member since: March 23, 2011 Total points: 138 (Level 1) Add Contact Block the food :)B 1 year ago Report Abuse 0% 0 Votes
